Consideration 1: Link social interaction to learning goals.

In group tasks, goals are often shared, not individual, but the personal approach is possible to add.

Hints

Plan which tasks can be achieved through different group sizes.

Consider how social interaction can influence the outcome, and how you can support the individual aspects of group work.

Participation in group efforts is crucial for content learning and social experience.

Aim for learning objectives that encourage introverted learners to participate in group work via channels within which they feel comfortable.

Digital tools may also be effective in making less extroverted individuals more visible within group work.
